entries.title: This creepy Android flaw can detect your identity and even gender
entries.description: You’ll most likely never encounter it, though, as this was an experiment in a controlled environment.

entries.title: TikTok officially banned from US government smartphones
entries.description: TikTok finally falls foul of US government rules.

entries.title: Laid-off tech workers are finding new jobs pretty quickly
entries.description: Amid cutbacks and lay-offs, tech, entertainment, transportation and manufacturing companies are still recruiting, report finds.

entries.title: Cisco Webex wants to help NASA astronauts make video calls from space
entries.description: Webex tested by NASA to bring home comforts to space travel, and it learnt some new tricks in the process.

entries.title: Microsoft Excel is finally making formulas smarter, and easier
entries.description: Microsoft Excel wants to teach its users how to apply formulas and make it even easier to link to other files and images.

entries.title: North Korean government hackers found using ransomware for the first time
entries.description: South Korean police claim more than a dozen online malls targeted with ransomware, with two paying almost $2,000.

entries.title: The iPad mini 7 is rumored to be on the way – but might not arrive until 2024
entries.description: Analyst Ming-Chi Kuo has some predictions about what's happening with Apple's iPad and foldable devices.

entries.title: AMD in 2022: year in review
entries.description: It was a pretty good year for AMD overall, but the heat of the competition proved challenging to say the least.
